step1.sentence: After four years of hard work and late-night studying, she finally earned a degree in computer science.

step2.story: Marco worked full-time at a warehouse during the day and attended night classes for three years. Last spring, he earned a degree in business administration. Now he's applying for management positions he never thought possible.

step3.story: When Jina first moved to Canada, she barely spoke English and cleaned offices to pay rent. She enrolled in community college, balancing shifts and assignments with almost no sleep. Slowly, her grades improved and professors began to notice her dedication. After five grueling years, she earned a degree in nursing with honors. Standing on that graduation stage, she thought of her parents back in Korea who had sacrificed everything. She whispered to herself that every sleepless night had been worth it.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: '학위를 벌다'라는 뜻으로, 노력과 시간을 들여 학위를 획득한다는 의미입니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 대학이나 대학원에서 정규 과정을 이수하고 학위를 취득할 때 사용합니다. 단순히 '받다(get)'보다 노력의 과정을 강조하는 표현입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'earn'은 고대 영어 'earnian(노동하여 얻다)'에서 유래했으며, 학위는 단순히 주어지는 것이 아니라 노력으로 획득하는 것이라는 인식이 반영된 표현입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 'get a degree'보다 격식적이고, 학위 취득까지의 노력과 헌신을 강조하는 뉘앙스가 있습니다. 이력서나 공식 석상에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He earned a degree in economics from Seoul National University.
